abstract: A file that is attached to a sample in the HealthKit store.
overview:
## Overview

To access the attachment’s data, get a data reader from the attachment store for each attachment.

You can then asynchronously access the whole data object.

Alternatively, you can access the file’s contents as an asynchronous sequence of bytes.

items.description: The name of the attached file.
items.name: name

items.description: The universally unique identifier for the attached file.
items.name: identifier

items.description: The type of data stored in the attached file.
items.name: contentType

items.description: Additional data associated with the attachment in the HealthKit store.
items.name: metadata

items.description: An asynchronous sequence that returns the attached file as a series of bytes.
items.name: HKAttachment.AsyncBytes

items.description: A sample that stores a vision prescription.
items.name: HKVisionPrescription

items.description: A sample that stores a prescription for glasses.
items.name: HKGlassesPrescription

items.description: A sample that store a prescription for contacts.
items.name: HKContactsPrescription

items.description: The access point for attachments associated with samples in the HealthKit store.
items.name: HKAttachmentStore

items.description: A reader that provides access to an attachment’s data.
items.name: HKAttachmentDataReader

title: HKAttachment
